H0.text: A membrane encloses all types of cells.

H1.text: Substrate encloses all types of cells.

H2.text: Cell wall encloses all types of cells.

H3.text: Stoma are the structures that enclose all types of cells.

A4.text: The cell membrane is a semipermeable biological membrane that separates and protects the interior of a cell from the outside environment (the extracellular space).

A5.text: Fungi, bacteria, most archaea, and plants also have a cell wall, which provides a mechanical support to the cell and precludes the passage of larger molecules.
